title: Update on Art and Cosplay contest voting
body:
Hey everyone, 

If you've been following the threads closely you will know that there was an issue with the voting module which let players vote multiple times through incognito. This was an error on my behalf and I have closed the two voting polls.

I have reached out to the artists and cosplayers to discuss what the best solution might be for this situation. After some discussion we have landed on using an internal panel to judge the winners.

It seems like player voting in general is not very popular among the content creators and I will take on all the feedback into consideration to make sure future contests are a better experience for everyone =D

Apologies for any inconveniences this may have caused and stay tuned to see the winners.

We will aim to release the winners announcement for both contests on the 13th of February.

https://media.giphy.com/media/jOpLbiGmHR9S0/giphy.gif

replies.body: Lol content creators don't want everyone judging their content.

I don't think that was it. Seemed that people were annoyed cause people were spam voting for certain people as all you had to do was remove your cookies. Which is easily done in incognito mode. It felt like some people had more fake votes then others and I mean that's just not a fair competition. I think the rational content creators want people too see there stuff or else they wouldn't put it out there.

My issue is more with the fact that riot can't even host a proper survey, not with the fact that it's being abused and whatnot.

I mean if riot leaves open a competition that gives out RP, why the fuck can't they use something that can't be abused to take votes?

They've used woobox before for contests that gave out even higher prizes ^^ but it only got abused now because people could see the votes and see that incognito was working to get more votes. It was an honest mistake on the host's part(there was an error in configuring the contest), but you cant expect them to have forseen the spam voting that would occur, since it never happened  before when they used the same system for voting before. Its good that they managed to confess that there was an error, and take action and listen to the contestants' pleas at least :).

as one of the shortlisted artists, i can say that i dont mind everyone judging my entry, i myself can see a lot of flaws in my own entry and would gladly receive constructive feedback
i think the issue is spamvoting and it was quite obvious the most 'popular' entries had a large number of fake votes, mine included
frankly this makes the competition very unfair and flawed, it made the polls a question of who had the most people repeatedly voting on incognito, rather than the actual popularity/skill/concept of the entry itself
i've been stressed out all day waiting for the announcement but i dont think it's coming today :/
^_^ best gif ever. Will the winners be announced on the these boards too?? :) Very excited to hear the results! good luck people :D :D
I will post it onto the boards as a new discussion

Personally I don't mind contest winners being picked via popular poll voting, but obviously its a problem if the system is flawed and allows multiple voting by the same individuals thus skewing the data
I know the team at riot already has a difficult time picking out the shortlisted winners from all the entries
perhaps in future competitions it would be better to find a poll voting system with an ip tracker or something similar
Quick question, will the end dates for each specified event be the same or will they be extended?
Let me update the main thread. I will aim to get out the winners for both comps on the 13th of Feb in the afternoon.
